ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I have gained much knowledge about the Indonesian language and culture.
I learned the basics of Indonesian and the culture of Indonesia.
I learned a lot about Indonesian culture and had the opportunity to create relationships with international students across the world.

I learned the basics of Indonesian language and culture. I gained a solid vocabulary that I can use to read, write, speak, and sing. I learned about traditional foods and practices of the Indonesian people while learning the language.
Beginning to learn the fundamentals of an entirely new language of for the 3rd time of my life. This comes with a lot.
Foundation of Indonesian language
I learned lots of the basics to build on for the next semesters of Indonesian.
Elementary Indonesian speaking and writing
I felt I got a good baseline of the indonesian language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The academic support in the course was very apparent, which allowed me to perform better in the course as the semester went on.

The professor is a fantastic professor and facilitates the class really well! The class isn't as stressful as other language classes. A weakness of the course was the large class size. There were 22 students enrolled and I think the class could have been more engaging if it wasn't as large.
There was great joy and excitement by both the students and professors to be in class everyday.

Strengths: Pak Indriyo and Uni Adel are amazing teachers. So energetic and kind, never a dull class. They go over everything very in depth and making learning Indonesian and the culture so fun.

Weaknesses: I wish there was a little more structure in the class, maybe have a structured syllabus and upload early onto canvas. For example, maybe start with sentence structure and word formation before learning random topics. Also, canvas could be updated more frequently.
Great mix of learning in a fun way and getting down to business to highlight the important aspects of both Indonesian culture and the language.
Great teacher and TA!!!
My strengths are the certain basic words and numbers, but my weaknesses are more specific words and sentence structure.
Very well taught
Strength was just doing exercises together in class to keep people engaged.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! I love Pak!
Yes I would. Learning the Indonesian language was a very amazing experience.
I would recommend the course if you're interested in learning a new language in a low-stress environment. The professor is great!
I would absolutely recommend this course. Because you have to go to class everyday for a language, it is a relief to be in a language course I genuinely enjoy attending.

Yes, I would recommend this class soley for Pak Indriyo and Uni Adel. There are such amazing and passionate teachers. Great way to learn a language (and fulfill the distributional requirement) with lower workload commitment.
Yes, if youre interested in Indonesia, or want to pick a new language, this is definitely the way to go.
Yes!!

I would recommend it to another student because Pak Indriyo makes learning Indonesian fun and engaging. I have never had a teacher quite the same as Pak and it was amazing to be in his classroom each day.
Yes I would
Yes. The course is very interesting, because I feel that know one really knows about Indonesia. Learning a language like Indonesian, which is an uncommon language I feel, is a fun skill to learn.
